Dissociate cCICs and MSCs from TC culture dishes using a 1:1 mixture of Cellstripper and TrypLE Express (1X).
Centrifuge resulting suspensions at 350 g and re
2. cCICs and MSCs compose the inner core of the CardioCluster in a 1:2 ratio (approximately 100 MSCs and 150 cCICs - per 500 cell CardioCluster).
3. Seed the cCICs and MSCs into 96 well, ultra-low attachment multiwell round-bottom plates in 100 µL/well CardioCluster media.
Store plates for 24 hours at 37°C in a 5% CO<sub>2</sub> incubator.
Dissociate EPCs from TC culture dishes using a 1:1 mixture of Cellstripper and TrypLE Express (1X).
Centrifuge resulting suspensions at 350 g and re
The outer EPC layer is created using a cell number equal to the number of cells used to create the central core (approximately 250 EPCs - per 500 cell CardioCluster).
Add EPCs to the 96 well plates that contain cCIC/MSC central cores using an additional 50 µL/well CardioCluster media.
Incubate the 96 well plates at 37°C in 5% CO<sub>2</sub> for 24 hours until CardioCluster 3D structure forms.
